pathways.title: Use Track
pathways.description: Learn to use the tool so you can leverage it to your advantage. Successfully using any tool requires some knowledge and skill. This pathway will help you learn how to navigate Track so that you can track and prove your learning successfully.

competencies.title: View Pathways
competencies.description: Explain how to view the pathways you follow, see your competencies and completion status.

competencies.title: View your competencies and proofs
competencies.description: Navigate into a pathway to view required competencies and see the proofs you have added

competencies.title: View your profile
competencies.description: Navigate to your profile to view your learning journey.

competencies.title: Add proof of your learning and competency
competencies.description: Utilize the 'Proof' feature to view and add a new proof to each competency in a learning path.

competencies.title: Share your profile
competencies.description: Share your profile with others to showcase your learning journey and prove your knowledge and skills

competencies.title: Explain why it is necessary to prove your competency.
competencies.description: Proving your understanding isn't just Track functionality. Proving your understanding is a fundamental educational concept. How do you know that you know something?

competencies.title: Identify what makes a quality proof
competencies.description: What kind of artifact will truly highlight your skills, abilities, and knowledge? What makes an artifact or explanation prove your ability? Judging the value of your work is a key skill in learning.

pathways.title: Learn to Learn
pathways.description: Utilize a growth mindset and grit to learn anything. Learning is a skill, just like riding a bike or cooking. In this pathway, learners will explore the science of learning and develop strategies to deepen their understanding and master skills. This pathway will help learners develop a growth mindset, resilience, and a love for learning. Learners will also learn how to manage time, self regulate, and explore learning strategies. This pathway is a great prerequisite for all other pathways.

competencies.title: Summarize the concept of Growth Mindset
competencies.description: Explain and justify the importance of a growth mindset in learning, and apply strategies to develop and maintain a growth mindset in learning.

competencies.title: Practice Growth Mindset
competencies.description: When learning, implement what you summarized when learning about the concept of a growth mindset.

competencies.title: Explore Critical Thinking
competencies.description: Justify the importance of thinking deeply about a concept and exploring concepts from multiple perspectives. When reading, writing, or practicing during learning, push yourself to go beyond memorization and recall.

competencies.title: Reflect on Critical Thinking
competencies.description: How have you implemented what you learned about critical thinking in your learning? Reflect on your learning and how you have applied critical thinking.

competencies.title: Research Feedback
competencies.description: Why is feedback important in learning?

competencies.title: Receive Feedback
competencies.description: Seek out feedback from a trusted source such as an instructor or professional in the field. Implement feedback to improve your learning and skills. Self-reflect and provide yourself feedback.

competencies.title: Explore Self Regulation
competencies.description: Explain the importance of managing emotions, behavior, and motivation in learning, and identify strategies to self-regulate effectively, such as limiting applications on computers and phones, silencing phones, and practicing mindfulness techniques.

competencies.title: Self Regulate
competencies.description: Select strategies and tools that you explored when learning about self regulation. Implement these strategies and tools. Reflect and iterate.

competencies.title: Discover Time Management That Works for You
competencies.description: Research various time management strategies and tools such as time-blocking or the Pomodoro technique. Implement a time management strategy that works best for you.

competencies.title: Discover Learning Strategies That Work for You
competencies.description: Identify and describe various learning strategies such as active learning, spaced repetition, mnemonic devices, collaborative learning, etc. Implement a learning strategy that works best for you.

pathways.title: Illustration
pathways.description: This pathway is similar to a college level program in illustration and visual arts. To prove competency in this pathway, deep understanding and skill mastery will be required. Completion of this pathway could easily take years. Learners should expect to practice drawing, painting, digital art, writing, research, and learn tools to get started in the art industry. Learners should also consider reaching out to peers or experts for feedback, as receiving feedback and implementing changes is one of the best ways to grow as an artist.

competencies.title: Define line, shape, form, proportion, and value
competencies.description: Define line, shape, form, proportion, and value, and explain how these elements are used in 2D design

competencies.title: Explore form and space in 2D design
competencies.description: Explain how to utilize and represent form and space in 2D design

competencies.title: Define composition principles
competencies.description: Define balance, contrast, hierarchy, emphasis, simplicity, movement, rhythm, negative space, and unity, to create visually engaging and dynamic compositions in drawings.

competencies.title: Define Perspective
competencies.description: Summarize one-point, two-point, and three-point perspective, and explain how to apply these methods to create drawings and illustrations that accurately depict spatial relationships and depth.

competencies.title: Explore 2D Design
competencies.description: Research 2D design fundamentals and dig into a particular area that interests you. Write about what you learned and how you can apply it to your work.

competencies.title: Utilize line, shape, form, proportion, and value when drawing
competencies.description: Apply foundational drawing skills, such as line, shape, form, and proportion, to create drawings that demonstrate proficiency and understanding of these techniques.

competencies.title: Depict Form and Space on Paper
competencies.description: Depict form and space on paper using a variety of drawing techniques, such as shading, cross-hatching, and rendering, to create the illusion of three-dimensional form and space.

competencies.title: Implement Composition Principles
competencies.description: Implement balance, contrast, hierarchy, emphasis, simplicity, movement, rhythm, negative space, and unity, to create visually engaging and dynamic compositions in drawings.

competencies.title: Apply Perspective Methods
competencies.description: Apply perspective methods, such as one-point, two-point, and three-point perspective, to create drawings and illustrations that accurately depict spatial relationships and depth.

competencies.title: Evaluate and Critique Contemporary and Historical Art in the Context of Drawing
competencies.description: Evaluate and critique contemporary and historical art in the context of drawing, identifying and analyzing the formal elements, principles of design, and conceptual ideas present in the artwork.

competencies.title: Reflect on Design Choices and Artistic Process In Drawing
competencies.description: Reflect on design choices and artistic process in drawing, identifying and analyzing the formal elements, principles of design, and conceptual ideas present in the artwork.

competencies.title: Blend
competencies.description: Blend colors to create smooth transitions and gradations in paintings.

competencies.title: Mix Colors
competencies.description: Mix colors to create a wide range of hues, tints, and shades in paintings.

competencies.title: Dry Brush
competencies.description: Utilize dry brushing techniques to create texture and detail in paintings.

competencies.title: Stipple
competencies.description: Utilize stippling techniques to create texture and detail in paintings.

competencies.title: Underpaint
competencies.description: Establish tonal values, enhance color harmony, and create depth in paintings through underpainting techniques.

competencies.title: Utilize various mediums
competencies.description: Practice with acrylic, oil, and watercolor mediums

competencies.title: Implement Composition Principles
competencies.description: Implement  balance, contrast, hierarchy, emphasis, simplicity, movement, rhythm, negative space, and unity, to create visually engaging and dynamic compositions in paintings.

competencies.title: Apply Perspective Methods
competencies.description: Apply perspective methods, such as one-point, two-point, and three-point perspective, to create paintings that accurately depict spatial relationships and depth.

competencies.title: Evaluate and Critique Contemporary and Historical Art in the Context of Painting
competencies.description: Evaluate and critique contemporary and historical art in the context of painting, identifying and analyzing the formal elements, principles of design, skills, and conceptual ideas present in the artwork.

competencies.title: Reflect on Design Choices and Artistic Process In Painting
competencies.description: Reflect on design choices and artistic process in painting, identifying and analyzing the formal elements, principles of design, and conceptual ideas present in the artwork.

competencies.title: Label muscles and bones of the human body
competencies.description: Label the major muscle groups and bones of the human body to improve the proportions of your art.

competencies.title: Label common proportion of the human face
competencies.description: Label the common proportions of the human face to improve the proportions of your art.

competencies.title: Create dynamic poses and expressions
competencies.description: Create dynamic poses and expressions to convey life in your art.

competencies.title: Draw anatomically correct figures and faces
competencies.description: Complete many drawings of people in various poses and expressions.Draw figures and faces from life, photographs, and imagination.

competencies.title: Research historic and current trends in illustration
competencies.description: Research historic and current trends in illustration and apply them to your work. Consider mediums and tools used by illustrators in the past and present. Consider styles and techniques used by illustrators in the past and present. Consider formats and genres used by illustrators in the past and present. Select a historic or current trend in illustration that interests you and write about it.

competencies.title: Develop a unique style and voice
competencies.description: Develop a unique style and voice in your illustrations. Consider the formal elements and principles of design in your work. Consider the conceptual ideas and themes in your work. Consider the techniques and mediums in your work. Consider the formats and genres in your work. Create a series of illustrations that demonstrate your unique style and voice.

competencies.title: Explore formats and genres in illustration
competencies.description: Create illustrations for books, magazines, advertisements, and other media. Create illustrations in genres such as fantasy, science fiction, horror, and more. Create illustrations in formats such as editorial, advertising, and children's books. Create illustrations that tell a story or convey a message. Create illustrations that evoke emotions or moods.

competencies.title: Seek out feedback
competencies.description: Seek out feedback from peers and professionals to improve your work.

competencies.title: Explore digital art tools
competencies.description: Test out Photoshop, Illustrator, and Procreate. Create a series of digital illustrations using these tools. Reflect on your experience and the results.

competencies.title: Define layers, vectors, raster, and brushes
competencies.description: Develop vocabulary to describe digital art tools.

competencies.title: Summarize the importance of file formats and resolution
competencies.description: Research file format options and resolutions in digital art. Print out some of your work to see how it looks in print.

competencies.title: Apply fundamental art concepts to your digital work
competencies.description: Apply traditional drawing and painting techniques to your digital work. Create a series of digital illustrations using these techniques. Consider line, shape, form, proportion, value, perspective, composition, color, texture, and more in your work.

competencies.title: Create a portfolio
competencies.description: Organize your work into a cohesive portfolio that demonstrates your skills and style. Consider your audience and goals when building this.

competencies.title: Research copyright laws
competencies.description: Research copyright laws to protect your work and understand how to use other's work.

competencies.title: Research marketing as an artist
competencies.description: Research marketing as an artist to understand how to promote your work and reach your audience. Createa marketing plan for your work.

competencies.title: Create a resume
competencies.description: Create a resume that highlights your skills and experience as an artist. Consider your audience and goals when building this. Find examples and templates to help guide you.

competencies.title: Build a social media presence
competencies.description: Considering your marketing research and goals, you may want to create a Instagram, TikTok, Facebook page, Society 6, Redbubble, Twitch or Youtube channel, or website. Consider your audience and goals when building this.

competencies.title: Network with other artists
competencies.description: Find meetups, job fairs, or online communities to connect with other artists. Seek out feedback from peers and professionals to improve your work.

competencies.title: Seek out opportunities to exhibit and sell your work
competencies.description: Research local galleries, art fairs, and online platforms to exhibit and sell your work.

competencies.title: Research jobs that align with your skills
competencies.description: Research jobs such as illustrator, concept artist, storyboard artist, graphic designer, art director, and more. Create a list of potential jobs that interest you. Go through various job boards and find job postings that interest you. If there are any skills missing, research how to acquire them. Consider internships!

competencies.title: Identify major artists, movements, and periods including Western and non-Western art.
competencies.description: In your writings, showcase your ability to communicate clearly and effectively.

competencies.title: Summarize time periods from prehistory to medieval and Renaissance to today
competencies.description: In your writings, showcase your ability to communicate clearly and effectively.

competencies.title: Research and write about several topics and movements within the history of art that interests you. Reflect on how art has changed and influenced society
competencies.description: In your writings, showcase your ability to communicate clearly and effectively.

competencies.title: Justify the importance of understanding art history in the context of your own work
competencies.description: In your writings, showcase your ability to communicate clearly and effectively.

competencies.title: Explore art in history
competencies.description: Create a series of illustrations that are inspired by a particular time period or movement in art history. Reflect on your experience and the results.

competencies.title: Create art utilizing printmaking
competencies.description: Create a series of prints using various printmaking techniques such as woodcut, linocut, etching, lithography, or screenprinting. Note how the process differs from drawing and painting and how it affects your ability to communicate visually.

competencies.title: Create art utilizing sculpture
competencies.description: Create a series of prints using various sculpture techniques such as carving, modeling, casting, pottery, ceramics. Note how the process differs from drawing and painting and how it affects your ability to communicate visually.

competencies.title: Create art utilizing photography
competencies.description: Create a series of prints using various photography techniques such as long exposure, time-lapse, macro. Note how the process differs from drawing and painting and how it affects your ability to communicate visually.

competencies.title: Reflect on your experience utlizing a new medium and the results.
competencies.description: Summarize your experience and the results of creating in new mediums by creating a video, paper, or presentation.

competencies.title: Explore panel layouts and pacing
competencies.description: Layouts and pacing are crucial to the storytelling in a graphic novel. Identify ways to control the readers experience of time and space in graphic novels.

competencies.title: Control the viewer's experience of time
competencies.description: Create a series of stories in art that convey seconds, then minutes, then hours, then days, then weeks or months.

competencies.title: Identify basics of story writing
competencies.description: Research story telling and how it applies to graphic novels. Write a short story and create a storyboard for it.

competencies.title: Design a character
competencies.description: Research how to create a character that has depth, personality and visual appeal. Create a character to use in a short visual story.

competencies.title: Seek out feedback
competencies.description: Have friends, peers, and professionals review and critique your work. Implement changes based on feedback.

competencies.title: Explore mediums and styles in Graphic Novels
competencies.description: Identify the various forms that graphic novels take. Pick one that interests you and create a short visual story in that style. Consider your tools, line work, color work, texture, composition, and more.

pathways.title: Computer Science
pathways.description: Embark on a comprehensive self-learning journey in Computer Science, inpsired by college-level programs. Achieving mastery in this pathway demands a dedicated commitment, and the process may span several years. This pathway involves many content areas, including programming, algorithms, data structures, software development methodologies, databases, and computer architecture. Hands-on coding projects and collaborative learning will be integral to the process. Networking with fellow learners, participating in online communities, and seeking mentorship from experienced professionals will enhance the learning experience. Regularly applying learned concepts in practical scenarios and staying updated with industry trends will be crucial; you must build projects. Embracing a growth mindset, resilience, and continuous curiosity are key attributes for success in this self-learning path.

competencies.title: Graph Functions
competencies.description: Graph functions including linear, quadratic, exponential, logarithmic, and trigonometric functions.

competencies.title: Interpret graphs of functions and their transformations.
competencies.description: Given a graph of a function, correctly identify the function and its transformations.

competencies.title: Evaluate limits algebraically and graphically
competencies.description: Calculate limits of functions including rational functions, trigonometric functions, and piecewise functions. Explain the connection of limits and continuity.

competencies.title: Compute derivatives using basic rules
competencies.description: Differentiate functions using the sum rule, product rule, quotient rule, and chain rule. Apply these rules systematically to various types of functions.

competencies.title: Apply derivatives to solve real-world problems
competencies.description: Use derivatives to analyze rates of change in real-world contexts such as motion, population growth, and economics. Solve optimization problems by finding critical points and classifying them using the first and second derivative tests.

competencies.title: Find areas under curves using integration
competencies.description: Compute the area enclosed by curves by setting up definite integrals over appropriate intervals. Interpret the result geometrically as the area under the curve.

competencies.title: Calculate the average value of a function over an interval
competencies.description: Determine the average value of a function over a closed interval by computing the definite integral of the function over that interval and dividing by the length of the interval.

competencies.title: Solve problems involving accumulation and motion using integration
competencies.description: Apply integration to solve problems related to accumulation, such as finding total distance traveled or total amount accumulated over time. Use integration to analyze motion by computing displacement, velocity, and acceleration functions.

competencies.title: Differentiate and integrate transcendental functions
competencies.description: Apply differentiation techniques to find derivatives of trigonometric, exponential, and logarithmic functions. Integrate transcendental functions using appropriate techniques such as trigonometric substitution and integration by parts.

competencies.title: Apply differentiation and integration techniques
competencies.description: Utilize advanced techniques such as implicit differentiation, logarithmic differentiation, and trigonometric substitution to differentiate and integrate functions efficiently.

competencies.title: Analyze convergence and divergence of sequences and series
competencies.description: Determine convergence or divergence of sequences and series by applying various convergence tests such as the ratio test, root test, and comparison tests. Identify alternating series and demonstrate understanding by applying the alternating series test.

competencies.title: Compute Taylor and Maclaurin series expansions
competencies.description: Compute Taylor polynomials and Maclaurin series expansions for functions centered at a given point. Demonstrate proficiency in generating accurate series expansions to approximate functions.

competencies.title: Apply Taylor and Maclaurin series expansions
competencies.description: Apply Taylor and Maclaurin series expansions to approximate functions and estimate function values. Illustrate proficiency by accurately using series expansions in real-world or mathematical contexts.

pathways.title: Front End Development Fundamentals
pathways.description: When users interact with a web page or application, they're really interacting with the front end. This pathway is designed to help you learn the skills you need to become a front end developer. You'll learn how to build web pages and applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. You'll also learn how to use popular front end frameworks and libraries like React, Vue, or Angular. This pathway does not focus on design in any way - it is a myth that front end web development is rooted in design. This pathway is for those who want to build the interactive parts of a website or application using code and problem solving skills.

competencies.title: Build Pages with Semantic HTML
competencies.description: Create valid HTML with elements that provide meaningful information about the document. Use tags like <html>, <head>, <article>, <body>, <main>, <footer>, etc.

competencies.title: Organize Text in HTML
competencies.description:
Appropriately utilize

through

tags,

tags, as well as list tags.

competencies.title: Create Hyperlinks to link to other pages
competencies.description: Use the <a> anchor tag to create hyperlinks to other pages.

competencies.title: Include Images and other media in HTML
competencies.description: Utilize the and other tags such as

competencies.title: Create forms
competencies.description: Build forms to collect user imput. You'll connect JS to these forms later.

competencies.title: Show data clearly
competencies.description: Use tables to display data.

competencies.title: Define core CSS concepts
competencies.description: Describe the box model, specificity, inheritance, and the cascade. Explain how these concepts affect the styling of web pages.

competencies.title: Use CSS Selectors
competencies.description: Select elements using a variety of CSS selectors, including element selectors, class selectors, ID selectors, attribute selectors, pseudo-classes, and pseudo-elements.

competencies.title: Implement common layouts using CSS
competencies.description: Find common layouts throughout the web and implment them using flexbox and grid. Ensure that spacing, alignment, and sizing are consistent and visually appealing.

competencies.title: Use CSS to create responsive pages
competencies.description: Utilize CSS to create web pages that adjust based on the size of the viewport or device. Use media queries and use fluid measurements instead of pixels. Consider the use of flexible images and media, the viewport tag, and responsive typography.

competencies.title: Use CSS Frameworks
competencies.description: Build sites utilizing CSS frameworks like Bootstrap, Tailwind, or Materialize. Understand the benefits and drawbacks of using a CSS framework.

competencies.title: Debug CSS issues
competencies.description: Use tools such as the browser's developer tools to identify and fix CSS issues.

competencies.title: List and define the data types in JavaScript
competencies.description: Clearly articulate which data types are reference and which are primitive. Explain the difference between null and undefined.

competencies.title: Explain how to use Variables in JS
competencies.description: Define the term 'variable' and explain how to declare and assign variables in JavaScript. Explain the difference between let, const, and var.

competencies.title: Define the term 'expression' and explain what truthy and falsey expressions are
Use numbers, strings, arrays, and objects in JavaScript
competencies.description: Define variables that are numbers, strings, arrays, and objects. Manipulate these variables using common methods and operators. Use dot and bracket notation to access object properties.

competencies.title: Define and Invoke Functions
competencies.description: Create reusable functions that take parameters and return values. Use function declarations, function expressions, and arrow functions. Understand the difference between function declarations and function expressions.

competencies.title: Use for loops to iterate over arrays
competencies.description: Manipulate data using for loops. Write code that utilizes nested for loops.

competencies.title: Manipulate Data with Arrays and Objects
competencies.description: Use array methods like map, filter, reduce, and sort. Use object methods like Object.keys, Object.values, and Object.entries. It's helpful to explain use cases for each method.

competencies.title: Manipulate the DOM
competencies.description: Interact with the Document Object Model (DOM) using JavaScript. Select elements, create new elements, modify elements, and remove elements. Add event listeners to elements to respond to user interactions. This is when you'll connect your HTML knowledge to JS.

competencies.title: Handle Events
competencies.description: Handle events in JavaScript using event listeners. Explain event bubbling and event delegation. Use event objects to access information about the event.

competencies.title: Handle Errors
competencies.description: Handle errors by using try/catch blocks. Use the console to log errors and debug code. Explain the difference between syntax errors and runtime errors.

competencies.title: Debug JavaScript
competencies.description: Use browser tools, debuggers in IDEs, and console.log to debug JavaScript code. Identify and fix common errors like typos, incorrect variable names, and missing parentheses.

competencies.title: Make network requests with Fetch and Axios
competencies.description: Explain what network requests are and how they work. Use the Fetch API and Axios to make GET and POST requests to a server. Handle responses using promises and async/await.

competencies.title: Describe Promises in JS
competencies.description: Explain what promises are and how they work. Use promises to handle asynchronous code. Chain promises together and handle errors using catch.

competencies.title: Use Closures
competencies.description: Explain what a closure is and utilize them in your code

competencies.title: Identify Scope in JS
competencies.description: Explain how code works in the context of its scope. Identify global and local scope. Explain that the 'this' keyword is and how to use it.

competencies.title: Destructure Objects and Arrays
competencies.description: Use the destructuring syntax to extract values from objects and arrays. Explain the benefits of using destructuring.

competencies.title: Share code between files using modules
competencies.description: Utilize modules to share code between files. Explain the benefits of using modules and how to import and export modules.

competencies.title: Consider performance
competencies.description: Describe the basics of Big O notation and how it relates to JavaScript. Explain how to optimize code for performance.

competencies.title: Define higher order functions
competencies.description: Explain what higher order functions are and how to use them. Use higher order functions like map, filter, and reduce to manipulate data.

competencies.title: Research Programming Paradigms
competencies.description: Research and explain the difference between imperative and declarative programming. Explain the difference between procedural and object-oriented programming.

competencies.title: Annotate types for variables, functions, and objects
competencies.description: Define variables and objects with explicit types along with function parameters and return values. Use type annotations to describe the shape of objects.

competencies.title: Utilize interfaces and types
competencies.description: Create interfaces and types to define the shape of objects. Use interfaces to describe the structure of objects and types to define custom types.

competencies.title: Describe Generics
competencies.description: Explain generics and how they can be used to create reusable components. Use generics to create flexible and reusable functions and classes.

pathways.title: Unity 2D Game Development
pathways.description: This pathway will guide learners to create 2D games utilizing the Unity Engine. This pathway includes fundamentals of Unity's 2D features, including sprite management, physics, animation, and user interface design. Starting with basic concepts, such as setting up a project and navigating the Unity interface, learners will progress to more advanced topics like scripting in C#, implementing game mechanics, optimizing performance, and publishing games to various platforms. Learners should push to build their own games instead of simply consuming related educational content.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Music Perforamance Fundamentals
pathways.description: Begin a foundational journey in music performance, focusing on essential skills applicable to any instrument. This pathway introduces instrument pedagogy, covering techniques like posture and hand positioning, alongside fundamental music theory such as scales, intervals, and rhythm. Learners will develop technical proficiency through exercises and repertoire, including scales, arpeggios, and finger exercises, while also honing ear training and sight-reading abilities. Regular practice sessions and performance opportunities will solidify learning, with feedback from instructors and peers guiding progress towards confident and expressive musical performance.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Japanese Language
pathways.description: Gain proficiency in the Japanese language through this pathway, which is closely modeled after traditional university degrees. Learners will practice grammar, vocubulary, reading, writing, and oral communication skills. This pathway will also guide learners to explore Japanese culture and history, and to engage with native speakers to practice their language skills. Learners should expect to spend several years to achieve proficiency in the fundamentals of Japanese language.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Event Planning and Management
pathways.description: Learn the principles and practices of event planning and management, including event design, budgeting, logistics, vendor management, marketing, and coordination, to organize successful events such as conferences, weddings, and corporate functions.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Artistic Roller Skating
pathways.description: Master the art of roller skating through artistic expression. Learners will develop fundamental skating skills, including balance, agility, and coordination, while also exploring artistic elements such jumps, styles, and choreography. This pathway will guide learners to develop a skating routine, and to engage in regular practice opportunities to refine their skills. Learners should also seek feedback from experienced skaters to improve their technique and artistry. This pathway is designed for people who want to learn to roller skate with no prior experience and strive for artistic expression through skating.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Project Management
pathways.description: This pathway will prepare learners to successfully manage projects by providing a comprehensive understanding of project management principles, tools, and techniques. Learners will explore project initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closing, while also developing essential skills such as leadership, communication, and risk management. Learners should focus on hands-on experience by managing real-world projects, and seek mentorship from experienced project managers to guide their learning journey.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Culinary Arts
pathways.description: This pathway mirrors the curriculum of professional culinary schools. Covering fundamental techniques, kitchen operations, culinary theory, and practical skills, learners progress from kitchen safety and knife skills to advanced cooking methods like sautéing, braising, and pastry arts. Culinary theory components include flavor profiles, menu planning, and kitchen management, complementing hands-on cooking experience. Learners should seek out feedback from industry professionals and get involved in the local culinary scene.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Emotional Intelligence Fundamentals
pathways.description: Cultivate self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, and social skills to navigate emotions effectively, build positive relationships, and manage interpersonal conflicts with empathy and understanding.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Financial Literacy Fundamentals
pathways.description: Gain knowledge in budgeting, saving, investing, debt management, and financial planning to make informed financial decisions, achieve financial goals, and build long-term financial security.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Outdoor Survival Fundamentals
pathways.description: Learn basic survival skills such as fire starting, shelter building, navigation, and foraging to feel confident and prepared for outdoor adventures.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: Graphic Design
pathways.description: This pathway focuses on visual communication, typography, layout design, and digital media production, providing learners with skills in graphic design software, branding, and multimedia design, and preparing them for careers in graphic design, advertising, digital media, or web design. Similar to a college degree, learners will need to develop a portfolio of work to demonstrate their skills and knowledge as well as demonstrate proficiency in fundamentals through projects, research, and collaboration. Learners should expect to spend several years to achieve proficiency in the field of graphic design.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon

pathways.title: SQL Fundamentals
pathways.description: Learn to manipulate data using SQL commands, including SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE, gaining proficiency in retrieving, filtering, and organizing data from relational databases.

competencies.title: competencies coming soon
competencies.description: coming soon
